hydroengine package¶

Submodules¶

hydroengine.RRmodel module¶

class hydroengine.RRmodel.RRmodel(dt)¶

Bases: object

Base class defining the basic interface of rainfall runoff models.

The actual rainfall runoff models are implemented in a derived class. This class must override the runoff() and run_time_step() methods

run_time_step(*args)¶

Virtual method to be overriden by a derived class. Derived class must implement the run_time_step method(). This method must run the model forward one time step.

No specifications for input arguments and return values

runoff()¶

Virtual method to be overriden by a derived class.

Returns:Derived class must return a list of streamflows, with one element per node in the domain.

hydroengine.aux_models module¶

hydroengine.aux_models.hamon_pe(t_avg, latitude, doy)¶

Computes potential evapotranspiration using the Hamon method, which depends on average temperature, daytime length, and saturation vapor pressure

Parameters:
  • t_avg – Average temperature, C
  • latitude – latitude, deg
  • doy – day of year, starting on jan 1st
Returns:

evapotranspiration, mm/day

hydroengine.hydroengine module¶

class hydroengine.hydroengine.Routing(conn, dt)¶

Bases: object

A hydrologic engine for a water management and decision support system.

This is the central class of the hydrologic component. It is initialized with the connectivity matrix of the network and routes runoff generated at each node subcatchment through out the network.

It uses outputs from the rainfall runoff models as water so

muskingum_routing(Qt, K, e, qnew, qold)¶

Routes water through a network graph using the Muskingum-Cunge method.

This function takes an initial distribution of streamflows at nodes in the network and routes them one time step.

Parameters:
  • Qt – vector of streamflows at time t
  • K – vector of reach storage parameters of size n.
  • e – vector of balances between inflows and outflows
  • q – vector of lateral inflows
Returns:

vector of size n with streamflows at time t+1.
